text: Well, how to give Aradhana villas enough praise!? The location is great- 4 mins walk to restaurants, bars and cafes galore. 5 mins walk to the beach, and more beach bars or water sports. The villa itself is beautiful- lovely big private pool with cute water fountains. Comfy living space with equipped kitchen. Bedroom is air conditioned and bathroom has fantastic shower and free standing tub! Everything was clean and spotless, with nice touches like dressing gowns, amenities and free drinking water. But best of all was the service- friendly, informative, the team really couldn't do enough. They even arranged late check out for us. We would go back in a second- thankyou for a perfect start aradhana! Only suggestion would be to invest in a Bluetooth enabled music device for guests :)

text: Writing from Aradhana villa no 8 now. I am so glad we booked Aradhana for our stay in Canggu. I did a lot of research of Canggu villas and decided this was the pick and I was correct. Everything is perfect even the pathway down to the villa is spectacular. The villa itself is extremely private with beautiful pool and gardens with lots of little birds visiting the pool and frangipani flowers. The staff are all very sweet and helpful. We ordered Indonesian breakfast each day which was delicious. The villa has two large double rooms each with a spacious bathroom which is opulent but fitting into the tropical environment. Would suit family of 4 or 2 couples. Beds are comfortable and fresh towels and sheets supplied each day. Complementary drinks were stocked in the fridge and we still haven’t drank them all. There is nothing we could complain about and it has been money well spent as it was just what our family needed. The staff were always happy and smiling which is a sign that they are working in good conditions so also happy to support that. It is our last day today and it will be sad to leave and wished we had booked a longer stay. It’s a gorgeous place.
title: Absolutely fabulous stay

text: The villa was truly lovely, the pool was just so great to have.  The daily cleaning was thorough and thoughtful.  The food however was terrible  and they got simple orders wrong, the massage (included with our package but priced at $60.. was poor, considering you can get a great massage in many places for $10).  The free wifi wouldnt work after day one and after advising staff 3 times of this problem we got no response nor attempts to remedy it.  Fortunately my daughter had access to data on her plan otherwise we would have not been able to do any planning or staying in touch with family.    They didnt replenish the 2 instant coffee satchets that were there on the first day, nor provide milk, so without going out to buy, or requesting and paying for it, no coffee available.  When i compare to what we paid elsewhere, this definitely was NOT worth 200+ per night.   Also the only way to get out of the pool was on the side of the bathroom/bedroom with SUPER slippery tiles, so you couldnt get out of the pool straight into the outdoor living area, where fridge, and chairs were, so you had to drip through the bedroom every time you wanted to hop out for a drink or something.   Definitely wouldnt stay there again.   Find somewhere cheaper with the same facilities and hopefully better food/service
title: Loved the private pool, but disappointed in the overall experience

text:
I had a much longer review, but courtesy to trip advisor I lost a lot of the content and am just gonna have to some up some points here.

The villa was okay, not a sunny pool villa like we hoped it would be but nice all the same. I would recommend putting some form of a concrete strip that goes from the pool to the downstairs bathroom though, the tiles are very slippery when wet and there are times where you need to go to the toilet shortly after or during a swim and times is not in your favour. Sadly in our case, Mum slipped as a result and hurt her leg and back.

The staff were amazing, if you had a request they did their best to accommodate and were always very friendly and welcoming.

The food was up and down. Sometimes it was really good, other times not so much. Most of our personal issues were either inconsistency or mistranslation. For example, we ordered the Snapper Herbs Crumbles a few times, the first time it was amazing, the second time the fish was dry and the third time the potatoes were missing. We also tried to request a runny egg on our Nasi Goreng. We tried fried egg, sunny side up egg and then finally poached egg; the first was scrambled, the second was sliced omelette, and finally the third one worked out. Our least favourite dish was the Gado Gado, we had tried a street cart one before ordering from the villa and the difference was amazing. The villa one looked nice but tasted terrible, the street cart one was not too pretty but tasted amazing.

For the afternoon tea, we pretty much enjoyed most on offer, aside from the toasted bread pieces with the raw ingredients on it.

The drinks are mostly a pass, aside from Watermelon and Papaya, most of the others tasted like they were watered down quite a lot, especially the Pineapple and Strawberry. The apple juice was our least favourite. As for cocktails, we enjoyed the Tequila Sunrise the most but we often found better and cheaper cocktails 5 minutes down the road.

The shuttle service was okay, but it would be nice if they could be a little more flexible with shorter distance drop offs. It just feels odd booking what would otherwise be an in the moment decision to head down to the local shops.

The massages we had at the villa were nice, but very expensive, so we often went down the road for some instead and the quality was just as good.

My only real hard complaint aside from the villa tiles would be the distance to our villa. We were in villa 7, almost right at the very end of the path. My mum and I have MS, and my grandmother was with us as well (she has quite weak ankles due to breaks). I though when we first arrived that night that the reason we were so far down was because it was to cater to our request for a sunny pool villa, but sadly this wasn't the case (at least from our perspective as 2 hours of sun in the day that only covers half of the pool is far from what we were expecting). It's a long distance, and while I myself was fine still being quite young and able, mum and my grandmother were always finding themselves quite tired going up the elevated path each day.

All in all though, we still managed to have a nice holiday here!
title: Pretty Good (some suggestions though)

text:
Just checked out of Aradhana after 10 days there for my honeymoon in a 1 bedroom villa. Every thing about this place is incredible. The staff are all amazing and friendly, call you by name from day 1 and are extremely helpful without being obtrusive at all.. I can’t rave about them enough. 
The villas themselves are absolutely amazing, you sacrifice the rice paddy view for absolute privacy and it is so worth it. We didn’t hear another guest in our entire time there. The staff always call before food delivery or any service just to make sure it is ok with you. The villa is stunning, pool is clean and always refreshing and the maintenance men who come around each night to clear the bugs and do citronella candles do a great job. 
The food is all incredible and the breakfast menu has something for everyone, the juices are great! 
The drop off service is super great but be sure you don’t get ripped off in a taxi on the way back. Shouldn’t cost more than 50,000 in a metered taxi. Always use bluebird. 

Can’t recommend this place enough, can’t wait to come back. Thanks to all the staff for making our honeymoon unforgettable.

As with all the other reviews, my husband and I loved our stay here. We will be back! The villa was amazing. So peaceful and beautiful. I loved the outdoor bath and living areas. The pool is a good size and we spent quite a lot of time either in the pool or on the comfortable sun lounges. 
We can also recommend the massages!
The room service was very reasonably priced and the Indonesian food was delicious. The western food was also done pretty well. The villa was kept spotless by the staff and the staff did a daily mosquito treatment throughout the villa to keep them at bay. 
There isn’t really any reason to leave the villa if you don’t want to, but Canggu was a great town to explore. Much quieter than Seminyak but still lots of great places to eat and shop. We didn’t get to half the places we wanted to during our week long stay! We used the drop off service a few times with and found it really useful and easy. 
Wifi is decent but a little patchy at times.
Thankyou Aradhana Villas for the much needed R and R!

text: We decided to stay at Canggu as it was reported to be quieter than Kuta and Seminyak, which is was.  Aradhana is a great little resort with fantastic facilities and really nice, helpful staff.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with 5 of us in total.  The villa was very luxurious and is just as it appears in their promotional photos.  Our packages included a couple of meals per day and they were the only slightly disappointing aspect.  Most of the food was actually pretty good, but on our first day we were served ribs and potato chips and both were stone cold.  We also ordered 3 scoops of sorbet and they were served it as a liquid!  We assumed it had completely melted prior to being served.  We never complained about either of these things and they probably would have fixed them if we had done so - just thought it was worth a mention.  The only thing we did complain about was that on one day, all the glasses that the drinks and milk came in with very dirty, with brown muck on the inside of the glasses.  We spoke to the manager who apologised and told us it wouldn't happen again - which it didn't.    Overall we had a very relaxing stay at Aradhana and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Bail who wants to stay in a nice resort away from the crowds.
title: Nice resort away from Kuta and Seminyak

text:
A lovely little resort ... 8 villas in row straight back from the main entrance 
Our 2 bedroom villa had upstairs twin which was great for teenagers 
Everything is room service ... bit of a wait for drinks 
Food was excellent ! 
We had a deal that included massages ... they were great ! 
Good English from most employees which made life very easy 
Bali service and hospitality shines here 
Nothing is too much trouble 
The town is nearby Seminyak and walkable to a great beach bar called finns ... where opulence and decadence thrive ... order a 4 person mattress and lay back to feel like royalty ... you can stay all day ... amazing for a touch of difference 

The pool in the villa does not get much sun (high walls) so it was too cold for my family in july 

We visited ubud and Kuta did the silver factory ... with dragon flys .. unique was it's name ... well worth it 

Monkeys a must .. watch out for feeding ... keep bananas in singles inside a bag ... one monkey wanted the whole bunch my husband was holding ... when my husband refused he got a nip which then meant rabies treatment was required both in Bali and back in Australia 

We really loved our trip and made some great memories ! 

Enjoy x
title: Quiet relaxing paradise

text:
I can only concur with many of the other glowing comments about Aradhana. It is very private, quiet and in a sense isolated. In our week at the villas we only saw two other couples at reception where you could give a smile or g'day. This is the perfect anti stress location and obviously is not for everyone and perhaps not something you'd want to do all the time.
The villa is spacious, the outdoor bathrooms unique and a pleasant outdoor seating area, dining, kitchenette etc. It can get warm there and we did retreat often into the aircon bedroom. The pool is superb! Mossies are a bit of an issue altho not thru any fault of the measures the staff try to put in place. If mossie bites affect you badly well maybe it could be an issue.
The housekeeping staff were fantastic with great attention to detail, very organised and accomodating. The food we had in house, as all is room serviced was very nice. Coffee was often cool but nothing that couldn't be fixed by a boil of the kettle.
I would suggest the need for extra shelves in the cupboards as there is hanging space but limited other storage which meant living out of the case which is not ideal over a week.
Overall we had a wonderful stay and are much refreshed.

text:
We have just returned from an excellent week at Aradhana Villas, feeling refreshed, revived, spoilt and a little bit fatter than when we arrived!

From the moment we arrived we were looked after with friendly greeting at the airport, smooth check in. 

We stayed in villa 6, very spacious, immaculate, peaceful and beautiful! The private pool is MASSIVE! Wonderfully not overlooked and felt very private.

We had booked using a scoopon voucher and was worried we might be treated as second class citizens as sometimes happens but this was absolutely not an issue and the staff were warm and clear regarding our inclusions.

We ate often from the menu, breakfasts were excellent! The lunch/dinner was ok, well presented and tasty. We would love to see more local dishes available but I understand you are catering to western tastes. Afternoon tea was a cute addition but we didn't rush to order as we were eating ALOT!

We bought duty free bottles to enjoy poolside, the staff were more than happy to provide plenty of ice and limes. We also grabbed mixers and beers from the local shop just across the road. The cocktails offered were very yummy too!

Lots of people have commented on the location, to me it was PERFECT! Plenty of great eating / drinking spots within a 10 min walk or the super drivers would drop you off in Canggu / Seminak. We opted to stay local most of the time and enjoyed walking home in the cooler evening air. Actually didn't have a bad meal in a week!!

It's a super safe area. Quite so if your a big party person this might not be the right area, but if you are after peace and quite with lots of delicious places on your doorstop then this is it!!!!

A few small points for the managers.

Your staff are amazing!!! 
Thank you for late checkout!!!

We were often referred to by our middle names rather than first or family, we found it very funny and didn't mind but perhaps a quick guideline on the formality of European names.

We arrived after 10pm when the kitchen was closed as was all the local places. A really great added extra you could offer would be a cold snack waiting for late guests arrival - club sandwich or something like that would be perfect!

The above are so minor! Was excellent!!  Thank you again, we can't wait to come back.
title: Fantastic retreat from the heat

Beautiful quaint villas situated at about 400m from a not so known Berawa beach in the Canggu area of Bali. 
Talking of the villas there's nothing you can find fault in. They give you enough privacy and luxury you will want. The semi outdoor bathroom is  great, the shower head amazing. Only that expect a few tarantulas walking up your soap case, just be aware especially after a rainfall as the villas have a lot of garden area and the insects come out in the evening and after a rainfall. 
The semi open kitchenette is very convenient, really helped us vegetarians in a country which barely had concept of non meat meals. 
The pool is great and it's very refreshing to have an early morning and late night dive. We completely loved it. 
The bedroom opened directly into the pool which we didn't really use. Could have been a little larger and the closet area a little more spacious, I had to put some effort in figuring out some space to put my stuff. The study area had practically no light, but who would like to read on a vacation (I guess some people would). 
You can have better bath robes guys !!!
On the whole the villas are great and offer amazing privacy. We couldn't hear rest sight any guest, when they told us they had almost half of the villas occupied. 
All in all a great stay of three days. Would recommend Aradhana only that the location is a little distant. But you will love it.
title: Honeymoon in Canggu

text:
We enjoyed 2 wonderful weeks in a 2 bedroom villa at Aradhana Villas.  The villa itself was large & comfortable with a decent sized pool for the kids to play in.  The staff were always very friendly and happy to help in any way.  They offer a 24 hour reception service as well as free transport from the villa to Canggu or Seminyak which we found very flexible.  Room service meals were available throughout the day which was great for the times we didn't want to leave the villa.  The staff served us breakfast in our villa each morning & the menu was generous & the food was good.

The villa is located about 500 m from Canggu Beach and is quite an easy walk with kids.  It is nearby Finns Beach Club and whole range of gorgeous cafes & restaurants are just down the road.  Plus the Canggu Club is a 5 min ride by car and even in traffic, Seminyak is only about 15 mins drive.

We have been to Bali many times and have tended to stay in Umalas or Seminyak.  Having had such a wonderful experience at Aradhana and in Canggu we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.  The other great thing is how peaceful and quiet it was at our villa.  Even when we knew there were other guests in the surrounding villas, noise never travelled and we felt like we had the place to ourselves.

We would highly recommend Aradhana Villas and staying in Canggu.

text:
We just recently spent 7 nights in Aradhana's 2 bedroom Villa No 8.  It was simply stunning.  Our two kids ( 9 & 6 ) absolutely loved having their own pool and being able to jump in for a swim at any time of the day without leaving the villa was great.  The Service was fantastic and the staff were just beautiful.  The free shuttle into Seminyak and Canggu area's was a great bonus and very necessary as Canggu has no footpaths and not the best for walking.  If you do go into Seminyak, make sure you catch a BLUEBIRD taxi back to the Villa  ( the real ones have Bluebird typed on their front windscreen, there are plenty of fakes so be aware )  When you give directions, you can tell them that Aradhana Villas are near Finn's Beach Club, as they often have no idea where the Villa's are.  That leads me to Finns Beach Club, an absolute must to visit, whether it be with or without kids, its awesome. Much better than Potato Head or Ku De Ta and much more reasonably priced.   If there are no Day Beds available when you arrive, place your name down straight away to go on the wait list.  You will be glad you did.  I would go back to Canggu just for Finns. Loved it.  Can spend all day there.   
Back to Aradhana, the BBQ cooked in your Villa was scrumptious and soooo much food.   The daily breakfast is delicious and always felt full well into the afternoon.
The beds were super comfy however we did feel that the bedrooms were too far apart and therefore my husband and I slept with a child each and failed to get any time alone.  All in all, it was a great memorable holiday and beautiful location. Once you get used to the location of the Villa then you will relax.  Only 1 big fault, they do not do Cocktails.  Just beer. If we travel here again as a family we will go with another family so we don't feel so secluded.   A big thanks to the wonderful, hard working staff.

 A small number of restaurants and cafes are appx a 500m walk, take a small flash light as the road is a little dark at night, but safe. text: We stayed for 7 nights as part of a Scoopon deal in the one bedroom villa. The villa itself is fantastic - a great outdoor area, lovely pool and gardens and semi-outdoor bathroom. The housekeeping service is perfect - everything you need is provided, including bottled water. The villa is a close walk to the beach, but be warned, the entrance to the beach is terribly littered and deserted. It can look uninviting at first but if you persist and walk a little further you will find it is a nice walk along the beach to Finns Beach Club (go left) and Echo Beach (go right). It would be too dark to walk at night though. Also, be wary there are lots of local dogs around which gang up and bark at you on the way from the villa to the beach. You can walk along the beach to Seminyak which is quite a bit further but a lovely walk along the ocean. There are some little shacks on the beach near the villa offering hire of sun loungers etc ($5) which is a great way to spend the day. To get to Canggu town it is necessary to have a scooter ($6 per day). The drop-off service is great but you still need to get back to the villa. They provide bicycles which is fantastic, but the traffic can get very bad so we only ever took the bicycles for short distances. The food at the villa (although exquisitely presented) is average overall. The staff are friendly but we did have some trouble being understood whenever we needed assistance such as ordering breakfast or booking a scooter - it was often a very slow and confused process. As for the Scoopon extras, we were entitled to two free full body massage - we would not recommend it. I tried to swap the full body massage for a foot massage hoping this might be better but was told that wasn't allowed. If you want to take advantage of any of the Scoopon lunches and dinners you are entitled to you have to give 1 days notice - I understand this for the BBQ dinner but did not understand why 1 days notice is needed for the other meals which are all on the menu. Often you do not know a day in advance whether you would like to go out for dinner or stay in so this was an annoyance. Without these small issues our stay would have been flawless. However, overall we did have an excellent time.
title: Fantastic private villa

text:
On arriving they told us that our happiness was important and they didn't disappoint. The villas are pure Balinese paradise, whilst being clean and practically brand new. 

A perfect quiet spot just a short walk to the beach, or hire a scooter for about $8AUD a day and visit the amazing beach towns up and down the coast.

The hotel offers a free shuttle to Seminyak which is a trendier suburb of Bali but still as busy as Kuta. But the restaurants in walking (or scooter) distance offer a great variety and quality.

However the food served in the Villas is restaurant quality, in fact it's probably better than most restaurants we went to, and the BBQ is highly recommended.

Overall, whether you're after a romantic getaway, a family holiday or just somewhere to actually relax- the location, beauty, peace and serenity (the property is surrounded by fields and bushes), the friendliness and warmth of the staff, the attention to detail and luxury, the food, the tropical gardens and design, make this hidden gem a perfect choice.

Next time we return to Bali we won't want to stay anywhere else.
title: Pure Paradise

text:
The villas at Aradhana are lovely, just like the pictures! They are clean, the pool is great and they have an outdoor shower! The breakfast is generous and yummy and served in your villa at the time you choose!
The airport pick up we transferred one to pick us up from a previous hotel, they were on time and very friendly, and our driver on our departure to the airport was lovely and smiley! 
The villas are a short walk to the beach but it is the deserted part of the beach. They're not in the heart of canggu but from our few days canggu is pretty spread out so nowhere is going to be spot on! It's walking distance to berawa and a little further but easily walking distance to old mans! ( a scooter in canggu is pretty necessary I think)
BUT we booked directly, paid a deposit and were to pay the remainder when there. On arrival I enquirer about paying but they said wait till the end, so I asked if I could pay AUD or if I had to pay IDR. IDR was the response and as I only had an AUD value I asked for the IDR value so I would gave the money. Come pay day the rate had gone up up up and when I questioned this it was a big 3 hr drama. Eventually I paid what I was told on the first instance but my advice would be stay here, but pay before you do!
Staff were otherwise lovely a little inefficient but fine. Don't rely on the free shuttle it's rarely available.
Overall a nice villa
title: Lovely villa, but prepay!

Indonesian monetary policy is now officially request all payment and rate to be made in IDR (Indonesian Rupiah). All payment on foreign currency is to be converted on the prevailing hotels Bookeeping rate (refer to the authority of Indonesian Bank) on the day of the payment is made. text:
I really can't fault my stay at aradhana villas. I had never been to Bali before and since staying here I will visit once a year at least ! 
Me and my partner stayed in a one bedroom villa. The pool was amazing! Every morning at around 8am the water features would turn on so all day until late at night you would hear a tranquil flowing water sound. 
The free breakfast daily was amazing ! It offers Both local dishes (mi goreng and Nasi goreng) and western style brekkie like eggs benny, omelette and pancakes. You also receive a freshly squeezed juice a fruit platter and a side as well. We always chose the French toast ! We never got sick of the breakfast menu it had a great variety and we were always very full afterwards. 
We did order room service twice (2 mains and an entree each time) our bill at the end of our stay was $50 Australian ! Such a Bargain! 
The room had great air conditioning and was serviced daily with a complimentary refill of mini bar and toiletries. 
We could never hear any of our neighbouring villas occupants at all. 
Impeccable service from all staff! We felt like they really looked after us ! 
The complimentary shuttle bus saved the trouble of ordering taxis or hiring mopeds. Seminyak was about 20 mins away and the shuttle would drop us whenever we requested. 
We once caught a taxi from Kuta back to Aradhana in peak hour traffic. It took about 45 mins and cost about $8 Australian. So the location is out of the way which makes it more relaxing but still affordable if you want to look around the more populated areas.
title: PERFECT!!

The Villa's are well equipped with air-conditioned bedroom, private pool, outside & undercover kitchen & bathroom. Kitchen is fully equipped & you could cook yourself if you wanted to, but why would you as the in house menu was extensive, well priced & food delicious.

text:
We recently spent 5 nights at Aradhana and wish we had booked our whole 8 nights we were in Bali here.  It was simply amazing.  The staff are outstanding, every detail is taken care of.  We were here over "silent day"  which was a new experience, not being able to leave the villa complex, having the private villa was great.  There are so many pluses I'm sure we sill miss something.
We arrived the day prior to silent day we were offered for the driver to take us to the mini mart to get supplies, not being able to go out the next day this was great.  
The villa was absolutely beautiful.  Very nicely set up with everything at our fingertips.  We spent a lot of time at the villa relaxing and swimming in the pool.  We ate a few meals here all were good, highly recommend the Balinese BBQ.  There was a good variety to choose from for breakfast.  Breakfast was chosen the day before and served in our villa the next morning.  The table being set perfectly, it was such a treat eating breakfast by the pool every morning.
When writing a review I think often the house keeping staff are missed.  Due to silent day we saw them in full action. The pool was beautifully cleaned as was the whole villa.  It wasn't just a quick dust over it was cleaned to perfection, clean sheets and towels, floors mopped, used dishes and mini bar replenished.  At night mozzie coils were lit, a plug in mozzie thing was placed in the room, curtains drawn and lights turned on.
The Villas are a little out of the way which was perfect for us, it was so lovely and quiet.  There is a shuttle service to take you to Canggu area and Seminyak.  A taxi to Seminyak was around $5 AUD sometimes under, sometimes over depending on traffic.
A special mention to the staff and their outstanding service, they made our trip a memorable one.  The attention to detail was amazing.  Our last day our flight was a late one, we were given a late check out of 6pm which made it so much easier for us.  We did some last minute shopping and were surprised to come back to a perfectly cleaned villa and replenished mini bar, something we certainly did not expect, but was a pleasant surprise.
There is so much more I can say, but I think you can see from the reviews what a wonderful Villa this is to stay at.  Ten out of ten, it ticks all the boxes, We want to go back already!
title: Perfect in every way

text:
Summary: Incredible service, beautiful traditional villas, awesome food, brilliant air-conditioning, <15mins to Seminyak Square depending on traffic, quiet and safe environment. 

Service: The staff are incredibly attentive and considerate. Reliable when called upon and deliver with excellence. This includes the drivers. All are very friendly.

Accommodation: Pool was clean + comfortable temperature all day, bedroom is serviced/maintained when you go out to enjoy yourself. Pillows and beds are comfortable. Bathroom and Toilet are sheltered, although open and ventilated to the elements. These are also well-maintained and have a mix of contemporary and traditional styles. 

Food: Varieties in Indonesian and Western cuisine. Delicious and consistent! Nasi goreng was very nice (I ordered it for brekky 5 days straight, IDC, that's some good nasi goreng!) and fresh fruit + juices + tea provided also. We also had the Balinese BBQ for dinner, was very pleasant also. 

I'd like to thank Aradhana Villas for an awesome and safe place to stay. Sugita, I owe you Bintang. 

Cheers.

These villas are not short of gorgeous! The pool is a good size, private and a comfortable water temperature. Although it was very hot the air conditioner coped well in the bedroom.

The staff were pleasant, ever present and eager to please. 
The food was delicious and generous with serving size. 
The villas are close to Berawa Beach, 400 metres, but this beach is quite dirty and not suitable for swimming. However a short stroll along the beach either way good swimming and surfing and cafes are found.
A paper map of the locality would have been most helpful, but wasn't available.
Canggu is a quiet village with rice paddies, suited us, we were never hassled by hawkers while out walking. But some would prefer staying where there is more action.
Another suggestion to improve the villas would be to key the locks alike. There are four locks to the villa with four different keys, a tad frustrating. 
Overall we were most satisfied and would happily return.

text:
This is my second visit to Aradhana Villas and one day in I'm remembering why did didn't want to go home before! This place is a stunning retreat from the hustle and bustle of Seminyak but still close enough to pop down for shopping, drinks and pampering. 
Not that you'll need to go far, because the food at the villa is just as good as you'll find out on the Main Street of Seminyak. So a quite night in is a must. 
The Villa's themselves are inviting and well presented, and the open plan outdoor living adds a feeling of space to the tropical little sanctuary that is each villa.
We've stayed in both the two bedroom villa and the one bedroom villa, and both are as lovely as each other.
The staff are friendly and polite and always helpful, Onik especially so, she has beautiful English and always keen to make you stay a pleasant one.
The in room massage is one of the best massages I've had in bali, and I've been visiting bali about 13years.

text:
We stay in Bali at least once a year, usually more and generally stay in Seminyak.  This was our first time out in Canguu and it was a lovely, peaceful start to our holiday.  

Located about 5 minutes from Splash Water Park Aradhana Villas are nestled amongst rice paddies, a much quieter pace than the hustle and bustle of Seminyak.  The villas are more traditional Balinese in design, with an open air living area, overlooking the infinity edge pool and grassed area (perfect for our kids to run around).  Our favourite feature was the day beds in the pool, allowing for relaxation whilst watching the kids swim.

The main bedroom was located downstairs whilst the upstairs had an additional bathroom and open air bathroom.  The beds were comfortable and the villas were kept in pristine condition.

The staff make your stay extra special and go above and beyond to make sure your stay is enjoyable.  Transport to and from restaurants was included and made it easy to venture into Seminyak when we needed to.  We can't thank the staff at Aradhana enough for being so lovely.

Definitely recommend staying at Aradhana Villas in Canguu for a peaceful, relaxing holiday.
title: LUXURIOUS TRANQULITY

text:
We stayed at Aradhana Villas for 5 nights and every moment was a joy. Stepping into the villa and seeing the HUGE pool (which you can jump into from the bedroom) was such a delight. The decor is quite a traditional style, which adds to the charm. The semi-outdoor bathroom is also beautiful to have a bath underneath the stars. You have a lot of privacy as well, the only disturbances are room service calling out every now and then. 

In regards to the location, it is 5 minutes from the main strip in Canggu, and 15 minutes from Seminyak. They also offer complimentary drop off services which is really useful. But, you can also rent scooters to zip around town.

The staff are so lovely and really attentive, they remember every little detail. Big thanks to Ari and Yoshi, who really helped us out during our stay - they were so friendly and welcoming!

I'm really glad that we found this place. I highly recommend to anyone who wants to have a peaceful and well-serviced stay in Bali.

text: A lot of good things: pool and outdoor space; peace and quiet; staff etc. But things to note: almost no luggage storage in a small indoor space (drove me nuts)-not one suitcase could be laid open! The bedroom isn't sealed- spiders, mozzies and gecko poo (on the bed!) to deal with; and the aircon struggled. Although generous with mini-bar & water, no coffee/tea etc is provided. Breakfast was odd - one staff brings random trays that were never quite right. A massive bbq -quantity not quality (so much waste). By the time we found great local stuff, we were leaving. Guests would have better time if AV gave out local info -like dinner on Echo Beach and the fabulous supermarket Canggu Station. HINT:take own supplies of coffee, milk, snacks etc (stock up at the Station on the way). We have fond memories, but no WOW factor.

text:
I booked this place for my husbands birthday and I hope we can make this a yearly event. This place was fantastic and one of the most enjoyable holidays we have been on. I have to admit it was a little worrying that it wasn't right in the hustle and bustle of Bali but that's what made it so special. You wouldn't even know if someone else was staying there. We hired a bike which gets you around to the cafes and restaurants which are very close and many options. Staying here actually made us appreciate Bali more and saw a different side that we want to come back to. As for the staff, BEAUTIFUL. EVERYONE was so accommodating and helpful in every way possible. They were always smiling and going out of their way to making your stay amazing. The Villas are very clean and set out well. The beds are very comfy and linen always clean and changed daily. Pool kept clean and great aircon. The food, amazing. Breakfast everyday was always fresh and very good. We also had dinners and lunch and it was always delivered fast hot and yummy. 
I would like to thank all the staff for making our stay one of our most amazing memories. Even when we had ash cloud issues and our flight was cancelled and I was in a panic it was very comforting knowing that staff were trying to accommodate if we couldn't get there on time.
Thank you everyone again and we miss you already.

text:
Recently spent 10 nights in a one bedroom villa and this is without a doubt the best Villa I have ever stayed in. Wife and I spent our honeymoon here and we were absolutely blown away by not only the villas themselves but all of the fantastic staff that work here to make Aradhana Villas an amazing place to stay. Right from the moment we were picked up at the airport (2AM) until we were dropped off we were treated like royalty. The villas themselves are located in a quiet little area of Changgu surrounded by rice paddy fields and only a short 5 minute walk to the beach. Newly opened less than a year ago they have done an amazing job of designing and furnishing these villas, from the moment you enter your private residence through lovely Balinese gardens past your  outdoor covered dining and lounge area that is next to the private pool to your one bedroom villa they have gone all out to create a quiet, tranquil oasis.
Our package included daily massages, breakfasts and some meals and we took full advantage of these. Breakfast highlits would be the seasonal friut platter, watermelon juice and the omlettes. We left our villa to do our daily holiday making full enough that lunch was always a distant thought. 
Arandhana villas is situated at Changgu and it is only about 10 minutes walk to Old Mans beach and Echo beach is about 20 minutes walk along the beach where there is always a great wave and plenty of places to eat and have a cold beer, i would recommend hiring a scooter to get around the area as it is not that busy and hectic like Legian and Seminyak
The most outstanding feature of Aradhana is without a doubt the awesome staff that work here. They were always happy and friendly and willing to do anything for us.Onic, Sawenda, Yoshi and the rest of the crew were fantastic and as I was informed as they have all started at the villa as new staff at the same time when it opened they all feel like they are one big family and they make you feel like you are a part of it.
If you are looking for a Villa in Bali that is in a quieter area...do yourself a favour, check these guys out. You will not be dissapointed...we will be heading back!!
title: Changgu Charmer

text: We bought a scoopon voucher for Aradhana back in March and were slightly nervous.... but we shoukdnt have been! I have never stayed somewhere with such exceptional and personal service! Not to mention the huge, very clean, spacious and relaxing villas! Because there are only 8 villas you feel like the only guests. The staff went out of their way in every regard. From the drop off service (brilliant), to restaurant recommendations and bookings to rearranging massages to suit us and bringing me coffee first thing each morning, the service was faultless. Ariana heads a brilliant team, Ari and Oink exceptional. Yoshi waited 2 hours at the airport for us after a delayed flight and was still smiling! On the last day we were unable to have a late checkout (for a red eye flight) as new guests were arriving. I was 29 weeks pregnant so the girls moved heaven and earth to accommodate us until 1pm and arrange for us to transport to a nice hotel in kuta for the day. We couldnt be more happy or thankful. Nothing was ever a stress or a worry. The breakfasts were amazing as were the massages. The complimentary mini bar was a great addition.We were so happy with every aspect of or stay. The location is out of the way and quiet (what we wanted) but the drop off service gives you the option to shop, sight see and dine in Seminyak (or close by). A taxi is about $10 home. We dines at Bambu, La Luccino and Sardine. Highly recommend all 3. The staff even cooked us a cake for our wedding anniversary. Thank you Aradhana! You were awesome!!! xx
title: Exceptional!!! Faultless!!

text: I had the pleasure at staying at the lovely Aradhana villa's in Canggu from the 17-22 of August 2015. This property is newly on the market and exceeded my expectations to say the least. From the staff, the grounds and the area itself it truly was a relaxing trip and the getaway that we needed. We stayed in villa 8 which was a two bedroom pool villa, we felt like we were staying in a large property, it was so spacious and the pool was always the right temperature to have a midnight swim. This is the perfect place to stay if you want to be away from Seminyak but a short ride into Seminyak and Legian. The staff were always so accommodating to all of there guest and always held such professionalism and had genuine care for their guest. I am a travel agent myself and with a short walk to amazing coffee shops, minutes away from the beautiful beaches and restaurants Canggu is the place to be and definitely to property I will be recommending. For my clients.The value for money at this property was fantastic. We were lucky enough to have amazing 4 course breakfast sent to our villa everyday, massages, afternoon tea and the complimentary drop off service to Canggu and Seminyak anytime we needed. I travelled with a family and there baby of 5 months and before we walked in the door they had the cot set up in the right place, the facilities they required for the baby and they always checked on us every couple of hours to see if we were happy. The manager Ketut Ariani and her staff from the gardeners, drivers and ground staff all knew our names and were very welcoming. Thank you for a wonderful trip, we will be back again.

text: I travel regularly and have stayed in many places across the world, but this place by far is the best I've ever stayed in! All of the staff were just wonderful. Always greeted you with a smile and made you feel right at home. The service was exceptional and the villa was just incredible. We stayed in the two bedroom villa, which was very modern and comfortable. The infinity pool was surrounded by lush greenery, which made it feel like your very own little oasis. A huge gourmet breakfast was served daily in the villa, which was just delicious! It was in a quiet location amongst the rice paddies, but only a 10 minute bike ride to the beach. Canggu is a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle, but within easy access to Seminyak and shopping, especially with the free drop off service. However, with the number of top quality cafes and restaurants now in the area you don't even have to leave. I couldn't fault this accommodation in any way. We didn't want to leave and will definitely make Aradhana our only choice when staying in Bali!

text:
My girlfriend and I purchased a Scoopon for 5 nights at Aradhana Villas during May, 2015.  We were unsure what to expect as originally there were no reviews and this was a relatively new establishment.   

The customer service at Aradhana was excellent, they were happy to go out of the way to ensure every demand is met, including calling nearby pharmacies and booking trips (such as the Night Zoo) for us.   We also found the drop off service to be really impressive, were always happy to take us to Seminyak/Canggu and it was generally around $3-$5 to return by taxi depending on the location.   They were even happy to drop us off at Bali berries (amazing Frozen Yoghurt) one night at around 10:00pm when we were craving some dessert, then wait and bring us back!

I thought the location was great, in a really quiet, pretty sort of area where you could walk around peacefully and fall asleep at night.   It was only around 500m from the beach however as others have mentioned it was quite dirty and not really suitable for swimming considering the large swell.   It’s about a 12 minute drive to Seminyak and you’ll always be able to find a taxi to bring you back for under 5 bucks AUS.  If you’re looking for something closer, they do serve a variety of food at the Villa (we had a fantastic lunch and BBQ dinner), or there are restaurants (such as Bettlenut/ Roti Canai) which are a short drive away.

The Villa was really nice with an outdoor kitchen/bathroom and heaps of plants by the pool.   The room was well air conditioned and television had quite a few channels (although the reception isn’t great). Overall hard to find the negatives and what was a fantastic 5 days, was amazing to get back to the Villa at the end of the day and just relax in those beautiful surroundings.

Thanks to all the staff !!!

text:
The property itself is new, clean and well designed. There is a large bedroom with direct access to the bathroom. The kitchen and living room with TV in the open air. The swimming pool is quite large, however water was a bit cloudy as the pump was out of work one day.
The staff was very nice and eager to help. The breakfasts were generally OK, with selection of fruit, main dish (fried rice, noodle, eggs, and few other choices), toasts or vegetables. The juice, although in the menu named 'fresh juice' included too much water.

Small areas for improvements regarding the quaity of service shall include forgotten towels, open door left after room service, missing cups when serving tea or coffee, but these should not be considered a key issue.

The main issue is the location, which is too far from amenities, restaurants, shops, etc. It is rather in the middle of nowhere, so after dark you could only stay in the villa and watch TV or..... The beach is approx. 400 m from the property, but it is dirty and not suitable for swimming as there are high waves all day long. The property offers a complimentary bicycles and car transport to Seminyak area, but be careful. We agreed with the reception that the driver will give us a ride to Carrefour in Kuta, waits for us approx 30 min and takes us back to the villa. During the ride the driver changed his mind and tried to leave us in Kuta and offered a paid taxi instead. After short discussion we enforced that he keeps the plan agreed with the reception or we leave the property immediately. So be very precise when you book a complimentary transport. 
  
Overall, this is recommended if you require quiet and cosy place and do not need a beach and nightlife.
title: Comfortable but slightly too far from

We spent one week in a 1 bedroom villa. Berawa Beach is very close, but rather dirty and not nice for a relaxed beach day. Same here: Echo beach or Potato head can be reached in 15-20 mins walking the beach or by using the drop off.

Most of all: the villa has a wunderful design, the detached outdoor sitting area, the really big private pool and the garden are really marvellous. 

We were not 100% convinced by the service. text:
Having just returned from 8 nights in bali ( 5 spent at Aradhana ) I cannot rate this villa highly enough. The area is quiet but I feel like in a few years it will be a busy little hub of amazing eateries and shops. 

The villa was picture perfect, without any faults. Comfy beds and super pillows, air conditioning when you want it, multiple TVs, stunning pools ( however ours kept needing topping up to maintain fountains but super easy to do/have done ) beautiful facilities & the occasional wild life visitor ( rogue crab/cat )

The staff at Aradhana are also a fantastic part of this. Orik & Arri were our main 'receptionists' and those girls are wonderful. They smile constantly & their level of help & advise for the area was second to none. The beautiful lady who brought us our epic breakfast each day was also lovely. The staff who cooked our Bbq were professional and friendly and bril chefs & even the drivers were sweet and attentive. 

Take a push bike out around the corner and land yourself around cute cafes and beaches, rice paddies and local temples. It makes being that little bit out of Seminyak really peaceful ( read less scary around scooters etc ) 

I loved our stay here & have even been in contact with the girls since ( they check up to make sure everything was ok!! ) oh & definitely book a spa treatment!!! Those girls are tiny but so amazing! 

Loved it!
title: Stunning villa

text:
Stayed here on my own for a week. I had a one bedroom villa, which is basically a spacious outside living space, with a small kitchen and a living area with tv, a private swimming pool, an inside bedroom with tv and airconditioning (no mosquito net - lots of mosquito’s - they do spray), and an outside bathroom with bath and shower. Wifi is good, although you do have to reconnect several times a day. You get sun loungers and a bit of garden to boot, with lovely lush trees and plants. All of it is enclosed, so it offers a lot of privacy. The beach is close by, less than five minutes walking. If you go to your left, towards Seminyak, you quickly get to Canggu’s good (cleaner) beaches and beach clubs. If you go to your right, you can actually cross the river via the beach (via the water), which is a much better and quicker walk into Canggu than taking the busy roads. 
What I didn’t enjoy, was the apparent lack of trust. They instisted on photocopying my husband’s passport, even though he was leaving for the airport that same afternoon. They said they do this for everyone who visits. Furthermore, I was asked to pay seven nights in advance without being shown the room first. And they actually had a security guard do a full room check before I was allowed to check out... to make sure ‘I hadn’t forgot anything’. I heard the guard tell the front desk that ‘everything was found complete’ - pretty sure that didn’t mean that I hadn’t left anything.
title: Lots of privacy, less warmth

text:
The service is great and warm from Ariani and her team. But we feel the actual physical setup of the villa is not great. 

We took a 2 bedroom villa which is at the end of the narrow plot of land where the entire property sits on. Quite a walk in from the main road. We had a 6 year old child with us. 

Villa 
Most 2 bedroom villas in Bali are situated at the ends of a private pool. But this one is stacked one on top of the other. So it’s a pain to climb up and down the stairs. 

Rooms are really small for Bali villa standards. So much so we could not open up 2 suitcases flat in the room. Maybe 1, but you are left with little walking space. 

Tried to take the clothes out and place them in the wardrobe but the wardrobe is built outside of the room, in the bathroom which is situated outside, and is very warm and humid. So if clothes are placed in there, it will become humid and smell. The wardrobe did smell and there were animal droppings on the shelves. I’m certain housekeeping never bothered to check and clean the wardrobe, nor was there a system to check the work of housekeeping.  

In the bedroom, only one bedside had sockets to charge devices. Preferable to have sockets on both sides of the bed. 

Loungers by the pool did not come with any cushions and it was really hard and hot to lie on them. It was only after I asked for the cushions did they manage to find 4. I think the cushions should be standard instead of just rattan loungers. 

The common area ie open air living room & kitchen area by the pool is tiled. This is a big mistake when building the villa as it becomes extremely slippery when there is water on it. 

It’s normal to walk into this space after exiting the pool, or when water from the kitchen sink gets onto the floor after washing up, or after a downpour which we did experience. And we did slip and fall on the tiled floor a few times. Adults and the child. So beware. 

The refrigerator in the kitchen is installed in a cabinet which did not allow air around it to ventilate, resulting in the refrigerator not being cold at all. So we had to keep the cabinet doors open. That did not help much either. 

The bedroom on the second floor had animal droppings falling onto the bed everyday. We suspect there might be insects or a small animal living in the ceiling. So even after housekeeping change the sheets after, we still return to find animal droppings on the bed 

Food 
Breakfast is good. Timely, tasty and the team is always quiet when setting up in the morning. Something we appreciate. 

We had lunch and dinner in the villa too and it was good too. 

Location 
Good location and within walking distance to restaurants and gyms in the area. 

Ariani and her team tried to improve things for us but we feel the actual physical problems with the villa are out of her control.
title: Great service but the actual villa setup & quality not great

text:
The villas are just gorgeous. Honestly, the pictures cannot capture how lovely they are. Stunning grounds, large private pool and more space than expected. The bedroom and bathroom was opposite the large outdoor living area with the pool in the middle. Staff were excellent and discretely always ensured that the villas was clean etc. 

We loved the location which was close to Berawa main area and less than five minutes to the beach. Finns is also close by and we had a great time there. Do check out Avenue A - super friendly, great food and music. 

The villas are equipped with a small kitchen and there is a good supermarket close by if you were inclined. I know that they do packages but my advice is to do room only like we did. Breakfast and brunch is a big deal in Canggu and you have many excellent options on your doorstep. The one morning we did have breakfast at the villas, it was cold and the coffee was standard Bali coffee. And for massage, Dream is a no frills place which offers excellent massage from 100,000 rupiah. Laundry was very overpriced and I had to send two things back. 

Otherwise, my only recommendations for improvement would be a coffee maker/pot (strange omission when there was a blender) and mirror in the bedroom as it was rather sweaty trying to apply make-up in the non aircon open air bathroom. 

If we were coming back to Canggu, we would defo stay here again.
title: Loved every minute

text: My partner and I stayed at Aradhana for a week for my birthday and we had an amazing time. The villa and the staff were incredible, nothing was too much trouble and they even gave me a birthday cake and sung happy birthday. We were a bit flabbergasted by previous reviews, we had no problems with slippery tiles (we simply put a towel down) and we thought the food was awesome - try the pancakes and the Healthy Start at breakfast. We had complimentary transfers to and from the airport, a free fridge of drinks, lots of free fruit and a beautiful welcome drink. We were upgraded to the two bedroom villa for our last night and it was simply stunning! It's a 4 minute walk to the beach, a 15 minute walk to Batu Bolong and a few minutes to supermarkets, restaurants and more. I can't recommend this place enough. This is my 7th trip to Bali and it is by far one of the best places I've stayed, we simply couldn't find a fault with anything. Amazing. Thank you so much to everyone.

Canggu and Berewa are a little quieter than Seminyak and if you want to spend a little more on accommodation Aradhana Villas is awesome and we spent a week here, with the villas well set off the road this offers a really peaceful stay with your own pool and really lovely staff who were happy to assist with any query, villa offered a great layout and had all you need for a relaxing stay. 
We have to mention how grateful we were to have their driver take us to Kuta for a hospital visit after a fall and waited for us at no extra cost, it's these little things that make you appreciate the level of service they offer.
Aradhana Villas is only a 5-minute walk to the beach which offers great sunsets and a short walk to some great restaurants and bars. We would recommend Ahadhana Villas to anyone, we were not disappointed.

text:
Just got home after a week long stay at the Aradhana Villas in Canggu. The villas are very beautiful, the pool was the standout for us as you can just relax and swim at your pleasure. We didn’t see or hear any other tourists at the Villas the entire we were there, which was perfect as we just wanted privacy. The location of the bathrooms being slightly outside was really nice as well, however the mosquitoes are really bad. The staff were really helpful in that after a few nights they put a mosquito net over the bed for us- if you stay here request this the first night as unfortunately you do get eaten alive in your sleep. My feedback for this villa site would be to improve the breakfast and room service- the breakfast portions are really small, and you are only allowed one main. For the price you pay, they defiantly need to be bigger or give you the option to have multiple mains. The room service also has the same issue, and was only average. The shuttle service too is slightly misleading as more often than not, it wasn’t available- and is only a drop off service. In order to improve your guests stay, these two aspects need to be improved.

Overall the staff are so lovely, and the stay was very pleasant. The drivers in particular really made our stay as they are so kind. Thankyou for a wonderful stay Aradhana! We hope to return in the future.
title: Relaxing Villas

I had a nice massage but I agree it was overpriced for everywhere else in Bali, I paid 4x what I paid at the villa we chose in Ubud. text:
Just spent 6 nights here and loved it. Stayed in Villa1 and its beautiful. The staff are all so helpful and kind aswell and they will all do anything and everything possible to assist you.
Breakfast was really nice (omelette is superior to the other options imo)
Beach is just down the road to the right and all shops and restuarants down the road to the left.

The only problem i do have (and the reason i did note rate 5*) is that the in-house prices are ridiculously expensive.
A 60min massage here is 400k+ rp pp, 5 min walk down the road its around 90k rp pp... Thats over 4x the price and both are just as good as eachother.
Also the laundry system here 19krp charge for 1 shirt and they take it down the road to get it cleaned... I went down the road myself with 10 items of clothing to be cleaned and it only cost me 8700rp.
Absolute rip off and actually quite irritating. 
*MAKE SURE YOU SHOP AROUND!!*
title: Amazing place friendly staff

text: I was so disappointed with this villa.  All the reviews are outstanding so I can't work out whether I got the rough end of the stick or not.  Firstly our villa stunk like the drains in Bali.  We put up with it for 2 nights when I requested that we change rooms, thankfully they had a room to change us in to.  Note to you - don't stay in villa 1.  The staff did try to mask the smell but it was gross.  We moved to villa 5 which was much nicer and larger.  Also it had more sun.  I made a special request prior when I booked for a sun filled villa after reading a previous review - after moving into villa 5 I see that that request was not met, there is more sun in there.  On night 4 they didn't put the mosquito vape in our room - just left it on the desk and I didn't think much of it until I was woken up by mosquitos eating my face.  Yes I was bitten numerous amounts of times on my face - I have photos.  On the plus side the staff were lovely but they just didn't know English well which caused confusion and we sometimes got something different to what we ordered for breakfast even confirming the order with us so I would say that would be the kitchen, we would tell them but they still messed it up.  Then on our first day, we didn't even get offered afternoon tea.  I feel bad as the staff really did try and were so lovely but I paid alot of money  and worked hard for a great experience and I just didn't get it.  It was my 6th time in Bali so I'm not a novice.  The shuttle bus was a bonus.  The location is good, walking distance to some of the restaurants.  I'm trying to work out whether we just had bad luck and got the worst rooms and service.  So disappointed for the amount of money that we paid, I won't be recommending or coming back here even though we got engaged in Bali on this trip - it just wasn't the Bali experience that I have been so lucky to have in the past.  I feel sad that I have to write this review, it is honest and truthful.
title: Very underwhelming for Bali standard

text:
This was our first overseas holiday as a young family of 4 and we were a little nervous about having all the comforts our kids were used to back home so we could also relax. Ariani, Ketut and their wonderful staff made sure that my wife and I had everything we needed to be comfortable and relaxed for our stay. 

Our Villa was large, beautifully designed and completely private. Ariani and her staff helped with installing a pool fence which put our minds at ease (thank you!). 

The kitchenette had everything we needed. Our rooms were very comfortable and well air conditioned.  The amenities were kept well maintained and cleaned. And the staff were very attentive to our needs.

The location was perfect. We had a small corner story 50 metres from our Villa and a larger 5-star supermarket 500 metres down the road. 

We were within 20 minutes driving distance to the popular Seminyak restaurant and shopping locations. And a short walk down to the local beach.

Our family loved cooling down in our private pool. We enjoyed ordering from the menu, with breakfast being a particular highlight.

Thanks again to Ariani, Ketut and their wonderful staff for making us feel so welcome. We will be recommending Aradhana to our friends and hope to visit you again soon!
title: Tranquil villas, lovely staff

text:
First time in Canggu and we really enjoyed it. The staff at Aradhana Villas were very friendly and helpful and the villa was lovely albeit it battling with a massive padlock and bundle of keys to lock/unlock doors to bedroom and bathroom. 

We have some minor issues such as pool temperature as when the pool is so shaded that it’s is generally unpleasant to use due to it being too cold. This means the main reason to book a pool villa is not achieved and reduces the value of the villa and holiday. Unfortunately the trees around the pool have grown to a height that the pool gets very little sun and is overly refreshing to the stage that we used it almost not at all. 

Also, the food in general was inconsistent in quality and what we got might not be what we actually ordered. The banana pancakes are great but on one occasion my wife’s were undercooked. 

It doesn’t sound like we enjoyed our time but we did as none are big issues but enough that they could do with improvements.

text:
We have just enjoyed five very relaxing and enjoyable days at Aradhana Villas. For us, the villa was a perfect place to chill out and in fact we did not leave the villa for three days. The private pool was excellent, the bed comfortable and the bedroom was adequately air-conditioned.  We found the staff to be very helpful and we were reminded on arrival that the transportation service they provided was a "drop off" service only - so we had no issues in relation to this, in fact one day when one of the drivers was ill, management arranged a taxi into Seminak for us at their expense. Plus on departure we were transported to our new accommodation at Nusa Dua all as part of the service. 

Now the meals, we really could not complain, I was not a fan of their coffee and after we requested fruit juices to be made without water - they were good. The fact that the mini bar was topped up everyday at no cost was great - and the fact that the villa had a small bar fridge was also handy. Not much good for making ice, but all you had to do was ask room service if you needed ice. 

I read that someone commented on the noise from other villas - yes at times but nothing of concern - it's a resort where people relax and enjoy themselves.  I can honestly say that we are now in a 5 star resort at Nusa Dua for a week and I sincerely wish that we were still at Aradhana Villas - we enjoyed our stay that much.

Aradhana, is a little out of the way, but you can still walk to restaurants if need be.

Would we stay there again.....a resounding YES vote from us......
title: A small piece of paradise

text:
It’s so much easier to share a positive traveling experience, but let’s be honest travel hiccups are also part of the adventure that is woven into the landscape. From start to finish, a series of unfortunate incidents at Aradhana Villas made our experience there, less than satisfactory.  Individually each of these experiences can be easily overlooked, collectively is another story.  Here’s mine…
About:  Our villa at Aradhana featured a comfortable, yet stylish space with an open-air living area complete with a pool, amid sumptuous verdant foliage, and colorful flowers.  The spacious bed and bathrooms are enhanced by a design that reflects traditional Balinese charm with artisan touches. At first glance the zen-like atmosphere looks like a secluded refuge, until you hear the sound of lively voices from guests at the neighboring villa that make you feel like you are in a shared space. The location of Aradhana villas is a little off the beaten track, so transportation to nearby boutiques, restaurants and cafes, is essential.          
Need to Know: I remember reading on Aradhana’s website, that complimentary transportation is included. In fact, right on their homepage and then again, under their “location” tab it boasts, “Our complimentary transportation make it even easier.” Hmm, if only our experience reflected that claim.  During our brief visit, it seems that we had the supreme misfortune of having to negotiate every single ride, which was not something we particularly enjoyed. 
When we first arrived at Aradhana, we were informed by the desk clerk, who was also showing us our room, that in order to schedule a ride they required up to two-hour advance notice.  It is important to mention that an unfortunate mix-up at the airport with their driver, prior to our arrival to Aradhana, made us later than expected. Their driver went to the international terminal to pick us up, rather than the domestic terminal, where we were waiting. I had notified Aradhana in advance with the flight details, and intentionally provided the origin of the flight, to avoid any confusion when we arrived.  
After we offered our explanation about this unlucky incident at the airport, we pleaded with the desk clerk that a two-hour advance notice would be unrealistic.  Fortunately she agreed with us and offered transportation almost immediately. 
However. It was a different story the following morning, when one person from our group of three, requested a ride to Old Man’s beach to go surfing. It was denied, presumably due to their two-hour advance notice rule. Instead, we shared a taxi together, since two of us were heading out to visit Tanah Lot.  
Later on that same day, when we phoned up Aradhana for a return ride from Canggu, much to our dismay the clerk said Aradhana only offers drop-off service, and then suggested we contact a taxi to arrange a ride back.  I reasoned with her and eventually she said, “let me check on it for you,” followed by “yes we can offer you a ride.” 
We made several more attempts to request a ride that was met with the same resistance. In the end, they did reluctantly agree. It was a frustrating experience and because their website advertises complimentary transportation, we felt misled. If we had known about their strict policy prior to booking our room, in addition to, the out of the way location, we would have found somewhere else to stay during our Canggu visit. 
Food and Service: Complimentary afternoon tea is the best part, if only they could remember the order. The first day it arrived sans the pot of coffee we requested. No big deal. The second day, they forgot our order, twice. We were able to overlook this inconvenience when it finally arrived nearly an hour and a half later. Light and crispy mushroom fritters, arranged on a bed of mixed greens, with a sauce similar to aioli. It was delicious. 
Another small sign that lacked attention to detail was the breakfast service. The first morning, our meal arrived on schedule, but if the lukewarm coffee and cold scrambled eggs was any indication, it probably waited for someone to pick it up and send it out. The following morning, fortunately our breakfast and pot of coffee was delivered hot. It was tasty, served with a seasonal fruit platter and much appreciated before leaving on a long flight. :)  
In the end, each of these faux pas could be overlooked individually, but collectively it points to a staff that's not well trained and appears to have no one in charge.   
Etiquette Sidebar: I presumed this woman was the owner or manager of Aradhana, who I met, while waiting for a taxi, at the front desk. She never formally introduced herself to me, so I am not sure if she has a management role at Aradhana. But she apologized for our mix-up at the airport that had caused our delay the previous day. To my astonishment, she followed the apology with something that came as a complete surprise. Imagine the look on my face when she says, “Next time you come to Aradhana, remember to tell us that your flight is domestic.”  It left me stone cold for a moment, until I found my composure to tell her she was sadly mistaken. So I said, “I did notify you in advance that it was a domestic flight.”  
It felt like my reply fell on deaf ears because an awkward silence followed without an acknowledgement to my response. Now that I am back home with a little distance between us, I can almost find the humor in her absurd comment.  Almost.
It’s a shame, aside from the location, there are good features at Aradhana, the design, comfortable rooms amid tropical foliage, a nearby beach… but when a place doesn’t deliver you can’t help but feel disappointed.  
Anyway, on a brighter note, it was only a short stop over, and the rest of the trip to Bali was like a dream come true that felt nothing short of magical. I will be back to Canggu, but there is nothing from my experience that would draw me back to Aradhana Villas.
title: Beautiful Villas But Falls Short

text:
We enjoyed a 7 night stay here in May at a great rate thanks to a deal site in Australia.

Our first impression of our Aradhana villa was WOW! The outdoors area is beautifully presented in typical Balinese style with tropical gardens, plants, flowers, statues and tasteful decorator pieces.  The spacious, covered and tiled Sala is well furnished with quality rubber-wood Balinese furniture - dining table, 2 seater cushion upholstered lounge & single chair with coffee & side tables. There's also a cupboard topped with a tv.
Thoughtful inclusions such as umbrellas were a nice addition.

The pool was accessible from both the bedroom and the Sala,  and was a perfect size for the villa, with a decked lounger area & outdoor shower nearby. Tropical gardens & water-spouting pool statues combined to make the whole outdoor area one of tropical beauty and luxury. 

The kitchenette was well appointed with everything we needed or could need.  We did have a small issue with items such as glasses and cups being cleared away with our used crockery  and not replaced until morning housekeeping. Of course, it was only a call to reception to have new items delivered but at the odd time (eg early morning cup of tea) it was a small inconvenience that could have been avoided. 

The mini fridge is stocked with soft drinks and a couple of local beers, all complimentary on a daily basis. A great inclusion!
Plenty of bottled drinking water is supplied daily as well. I found it very thoughtful that extra waters were also provided daily in the bathroom for teeth brushing. It's the little things like this that make Aradhana such a delightful place to stay. 

The villa bedroom boasted an very comfortable Asian-firm king bed with quality linens and the luxurious bonus of clean sheets each day of our stay. Yes - EVERY SINGLE DAY! What a delightful indulgence! Once again quality wood furniture, good bedside tables & lamps perfectly suitable for reading! Yay for that! 

There was a small desk area, a wardrobe with hanging space, shelving and a small safe, a tv unit with drawers and ample space to unpack our belongings for the week. For those who've mentioned lack of bedroom storage - this was easily solved by storing suitcases on the wardrobe top shelf, designed for just this purpose. 

The air con worked great and we left it on night & day with doors closed to enjoy comfortable nights' sleeps and the odd afternoon rest in the cool.  With the doors kept closed this kept out the tropical bugs as well.  Kudos to staff for providing everything required to keep mosquitos & other tropical bugs at bay with coils lit day & night.  Having said that, we didn't find bugs an issue at all.  

The outside bathroom was beautifully appointed and quite spotlessly clean. Even the pipes under the vanity unit were shined! I kid you not! The outdoor rain head shower was decadent, as was the deep free standing claw foot bathtub surrounded by lush green gardens. The generous array of quality toiletries, replenished daily, was quite simply superb.  

The entire setup of the Aradhana villa is simple yet beautifully executed.  It combines functionality with Balinese style in perfect proportion. We had complete privacy and rarely heard other guests. The staff are genuinely warm & friendly and actively seek to ensure your stay is everything you desire.  So much so we had a daily visit from a lovely lady on the management team - complete with pen and pad - to note any problems or issues we had! 

Massive kudos and thank you to the most efficient and timely housekeeping service provision I've seen in years.  I swear the young man who re-made our bed with aforementioned clean sheets daily, did so with a ruler for exactitude! A mini army of housekeeping staff did everything not only perfectly, but as we were usually at the villa at the time, with complete unobtrusiveness.

All the staff were quite delightful to talk with, their warmth and smiles patently genuine. For Bali, this has become rarer ... no doubt due to the overrun of tourism. And let's be honest here, not all tourists - by a long shot - are pleasant people to have to deal with. Aradhana staff are obviously trained from the outset to a very high standard and this is reflected in each interaction.  

Upon arrival there was a small information compendium in our villa which gave some local customs and general info. Interesting but not particularly helpful.

If I could suggest a couple of small improvements they would be to provide more information on what's within walking distance of the villas.  We didn't realise until late in our stay there was a Mini mart and restaurants all within easy walking distance.  I understand the desire to keep guests as a "captive audience" - particularly where food and beverages are concerned - is important to a property's financial bottom line .... however, providing guests with as much information and options as possible should come first. Yes a free shuttle service to Seminyak is provided but we would have jumped at the opportunity to "walk out" for an evening meal occasionally.

My second small criticism was that the food, and we ate all meals in-house, could have been a little more consistent in quality.  It was very good on most occasions, but a few times there came in as sub average. We did particularly enjoyed the very generous breakfasts, which were consistently fabulous. 
Kudos must also be given for very fair pricing and an extensive menu that surely caters to most palates.  

The location of Aradhana is perfect for those who see the villa as the destination - and it was delightful to spend a week relaxing in the tropical beauty of own private villa and pool.  Aradhana is perfect for couples, honeymooners and family groups, even singles looking for chill space. It's the perfect place to regain a sense of peace and balance. 

Would we return to this slice of Balinese Heaven? In a heartbeat!! 💓💓💓
title: BLISS ❤️

text:
We have just returned from Bali and spent 10 nights at Aradhana Villas, they are truly fabulous, we went on a scoopon deal and were treated like long lost friends and part of the family,  the breakfast was very yummy and lots of variety,the free drinks in our fridge great, Bintang beer sprite coke and diet coke, all replaced free each day, also heaps of bottled water.
The bed is nice and soft and all the chairs and fittings fabulous.
The pool is devine and checked daily by the pool man so its nice and clean.
If you want privacy just slide the bolt on your entry and nobody comes in ,if they need to they will give you a ring.
The villas are very quiet and away from everything but the wonderful driver Sugita is happy to drive you into Syminyak just book the car the evening before to insure you get the time you want, but if you cant the fabulous ladies at reception are happy to call a cab for you, thanks Onik and Ratna, a cab should cost about OZ $7 dollars to Syminyak and about $15 to or from Kuta, remember to set your price BEFORE you get into the car, if you agree on a price for anything then it is like a binding contract and you must pay even if its a t shirt, fake Bintang singlets should be bargained to $4,remember bargaining is expected.
The only thing that wasn't great and I'm only picking is that you don't see anybody so you cant bounch ideas and make friendships in house so to speak and their is no local info or maps in your villa so you have to know what you want to do in advance, so come prepared with info and if you drink anything alcoholic besides beer you need to bring it to the villa with you.
If you get tired of villa food their is a nice little restaurant a few doors down who do nice pizza and deliver.
All in all a great place to stay and get plenty of r and r would love to return with the whole family
thanks for a great holiday
John and Tracey Villa 3
title: AMAZING ARADHANA VILLAS

text:
Wirklich eine sehr, sehr schöne Unterkunft. Wir haben eine Nacht hier übernachtet und hatten einen Privat-Pool, der vom Bad aus zu erreichen ist und vom Wohnbereich als auch vom Schlafzimmer. Das Schlafzimmer war das einzige was innenliegend war, der Wohnbereich und das Bad im Freien aber überdacht. Das bringt natürlich zahlreiche Geckos und Ähnliches mit sich :) An die Geckos hatten wir uns nach 1,5 Wochen auf Bali gewöhnt, aber sie waren natürlich da. Auch viele Mücken gab es (klar - alles im Freien) und Tausende von Ameisen scharrten sich im Wohnbereich und um den Pool. Das lässt sich wahrscheinlich im Freien nicht vermeiden, aber ist natürlich trotzdem irgendwie doof.

Sauber war alles, die Mitarbeiter waren sehr, sehr nett und das Essen (welches im eigenen Wohnbereich serviert wird nach vorheriger telefonischer Bestellung) sehr lecker. Und das beste Frühstück, was wir auf ganz Bali hatten! 

Für die Insekten und Co. und dafür, dass man sich doch etwas eingeengt fühlt, gibt es einen Punkt Abzug. Das eigene "Areal" ist zwar recht groß, allerdings komplett zugemauert. Es ist zwar alles super schön bepflanzt, sodass man recht wenig Beton sieht, aber irgendwie fühlt man sich doch ein klein wenig beengt. Dadurch dass auch alles überdacht ist, kommt auch nur sehr wenig Sonne rein und es ist etwas dunkel. Für eine oder zwei Nächte prima - für einen längeren Aufenthalt, würde ich aber vielleicht doch ein anderes Hotel wählen (nur wegen dem "geschlossenen Areal", sonst ist das Hotel wirklich klasse)!
title: Toll!

text:
Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits dans une villa deux chambres avec piscine, après avoir été surclassés.

L'extérieur de la villa est très beau : jolie terrasse sous un toit balinais, piscine très agréable dans un grand jardin bien entretenu. L'intérieur nous a un peu déçus : matériaux et mobilier un peu basiques et chambre sans âme, c'est vraiment dommage.

Le service est assez moyen : arrivée à 13h30 sous une chaleur torride, la chambre ne pouvait etre prise qu.à 14h, on nous a donc laissé nous débrouiller, dans un quartier pas terrible, pour trouver de quoi patienter. L'équipe est sympathique mais malheureusement peu efficace : nombreux appels dans la chambre pour confirmer une demande, niveau d'anglais très juste, aucune décision même la plus basique ne peut être prise sans quils doivent en référer au manager, ce qui complique beaucoup les choses...

l'organisation est également peu pratique : le petit-dejeuner et son horaire doivent être commandés la veille au soir. En vacances, je n'ai pas tellement envie de devoir prévoir un horaire auquel je vais me réveiller le lendemain et pouvoir déjeuner. Idem sur la navette : il faut la réserver 2h avant, et même comme cela c'est parfois compliqué et il faut insister pour avoir le chauffeur demandé. Ils vous déposent mais ne viennent pas vous chercher. Nous étions en basse saison et l'équipe était loin d'être débordée.

Le quartier, éloigné de tout, n'est pas très agréable : sorte de petite décharge juste à côté des villas, des trucs en travaux un peu partout autour, vraiment pas terrible. 

Un avis assez mitigé donc, peut-être influencé par l'établissement exceptionnel à Ubud dans lequel nous avions passé quelques jours avant d'arriver à Aradhana. Je dirais que l'ensemble est correct, mais que le prix pratiqué n'est pas totalement cohérent avec la qualité générale du séjour.
title: Très bien dans l'ensemble
